title: Home and Away: 9 huge spoilers for Irene’s trial, from shock witness to explosive outbursts
text:
Shock for Irene in court (Picture: Channel 5)

Irene’s trial is coming up in Home and Away this week, with explosive scenes set to air on our screens. From beginning to end, there is plenty of drama, with an outcome nobody could have expected. Here are 9 huge spoilers for Irene’s court case against Tommy.

1. It’s the day of the trial, and Colby is trying to calm Bella down. She’s telling her brother that she can’t testify for Irene, as the trauma of the sexual assault is too raw. While Colby tells Bella that what Tommy did isn’t her fault, will Bella find the courage to help Irene in her hour of need?

2. Irene and Leah have met the lawyer and are getting ready for the trial. Irene is concerned that Bella is nowhere to be found, but Leah tells her to focus on the trial and press ahead. Irene tries to hold herself together as she listens to the prosecutor’s criminal allegations, but finds it hard.

Tommy shows up as surprise witness in court (Picture: Channel 5)

3. Tommy has been called as a surprise witness, completely throwing Irene and causing her to worry about how Bella will cope with coming face to face with her attacker if she shows up. Irene’s lawyer protests, but the judge overrules and lets Tommy take the stand.

4. When told to recount his version of events, Tommy cries crocodile tears and says he feared for his life when Irene attacked him. He says that he and Bella were intimate, and Irene interrupted them with the violent attack. Irene bristles at Tommy’s lies and calls him out, exclaiming that that’s not what really happened.

5. Colby and Bella arrive at court, and Bella takes the stand. Leah tells a panicked Colby that Tommy has shown up, but there’s not enough time to warn Bella. When she sees Tommy, it sends her reeling, and she can’t take her eyes off him.

Colby causes a scene in court (Picture: Channel 5)

6. Bella does her best to relive the traumatic memories from Tommy’s assault, but struggles to talk about it to the court. Colby can’t stand seeing his little sister in pain and explodes, lashing out. He’s restrained by security and kicked out while Bella cries and Tommy sits smugly in his wheelchair.

7. Bella tells Colby that the court has adjourned for the day, so she’ll have to go through it all again tomorrow. She also tells him he ruined everything and she doesn’t want him there tomorrow. Already humiliated at being kicked out of court, Colby is crushed that his little sister feels he isn’t capable of supporting her.

Bella struggles to relive Tommy’s assault (Picture: Channel 5)

8. When Bella and Irene arrive in court the next day, there’s a huge group of women chanting with placards outside. Irene’s support group has shown up to give them some confidence, and they are blown away by the spectacle. Will it be enough to give Bella the courage she needs to face up to Tommy?

9. Once court has adjourned, Leah is shocked to find her blog filled with angry posts from the support group. She tells Irene it’s like a call to arms. Irene is mortified, and worries that the threats of vigilantism if Irene isn’t found innocent could affect her hearing. Will Irene and Leah be able to stop the support group from going too far before it’s too late?
